title: Springfield, IL
text: Springfield is a city in Illinois with a population of 116,250 as of 2020. It is the state capital.

title: Springfield Economy
text: The GDP of Springfield IL is approximately 7.6 billion dollars, driven by government, healthcare, and agriculture.

title: Python Programming
text: Python is a high-level programming language created by Guido van Rossum in 1991. It emphasizes readability and simplicity.

title: Speed of Light
text: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792,458 meters per second, denoted as c.

title: Earth Facts
text: The Earth's circumference is approximately 40,075 kilometers at the equator. Its mass is about 5.97 × 10^24 kg.

title: Water Properties
text: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius and freezes at 0 degrees Celsius at standard atmospheric pressure.

title: Human Body
text: The average human body temperature is 37 degrees Celsius or 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit.

title: Mount Everest
text: Mount Everest is 8,849 meters (29,032 feet) tall, making it the tallest mountain above sea level on Earth.

title: Amazon River
text: The Amazon River is approximately 6,400 kilometers long and carries more water than any other river in the world.

title: Tokyo Demographics
text: Tokyo has a population of approximately 13.96 million people in the city proper, making it one of the most populous cities.

title: Chicago Population
text: Chicago has a population of approximately 2.7 million people and is the third largest city in the United States.

title: Pi Constant
text: Pi (π) is approximately 3.14159265358979. It represents the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter.

title: Gold Properties
text: Gold has an atomic number of 79 and a density of 19.3 g/cm³. Its melting point is 1,064 degrees Celsius.

title: Mars Planet
text: Mars has a diameter of 6,779 km and orbits the Sun at an average distance of 228 million kilometers.

title: United States GDP
text: The GDP of the United States is approximately 25.5 trillion dollars as of 2023, the largest economy in the world.
